name: Revit
tagline: A backoffice application for Selor to evaluate candidates based on predefined metrics
body:
# Project description

For [Selor](http://www.selor.be/) an agency that provides recruiting services for over 150 different governmental institutes, we build an application to ease the scoring of candidates in face-2-face interviews.

With Revit, the judges at Selor are able to quote any job candidate from any device, whether it's a tablet, a smartphone or a laptop. A huge step up from pencils and paper for both the judges, the candidates and the administrative services at Selor.

Revit is build using open-source components and open development to ensure easy adaptability in the future. The application was designed, built, evaluated and deployed during an intensive 4 week program at [open Summer of code](http://summerofcode.be), an initiative that allows students to work on real world applications for companies and governmental institutes.

## Main benefits
The main benefits are clear from the start. We go over the 3 biggest ones.

### Fast
No more needless input of candidate data.
No more time spent on copying the quotes to an electronic system.

### Secure
Better overview of inconsistencies and anomalies.
No more missing or blank results.

### Adaptable
Last minute changes to a test become a breeze to change with the built in edit features.

## What is open Summer of code
Open Summer of code -oSoc in short- is a 4 week programme in different Belgian cities during the summer of 2016. The goal: provide Belgian based students the training, network and support necessary to transform open innovation projects into powerful real-world services.

Find out more about oSoc here: [2016.summerofcode.be](http://2016.summerofcode.be/)
